COMMENT_TX: $Tigers 3B coach Grover Resinger saw that Twins catcher Paul Ratliff trapped the pitch in the dirt, did not tag Wilson and rolled the ball to the mound; Resinger told Wilson to start running as most of the Twins entered the dugout; Wilson got to 1B easily and headed for 2B; since no one interfered with him, he started for 3B; by this time, Brant Alyea, who was trotting in from LF, heard Resinger shouting at Wilson; Alyea hustled to the mound but had trouble picking up the ball so Wilson headed for home where Twins Leo Cardenas and Ratliff had returned; Alyea finally picked up the ball and threw to Cardenas; Wilson turned back to 3B but was tagged out by Alyea for a K767; catcher Ratliff was charged with an error; after the game, Detroit catcher Bill Freehan said 'If Alyea had been hustling, Wilson might have made it home; Tell him to start coming in and off the field a little quicker.' Wilson pulled a hamstring muscle running the bases and had to come out
$Cesar Tovar had rounded 2B when ball was caught in LF; he failed to touch the bag on the way back to 1B and was out on appeal; not a DP
$George Mitterwald called for obstruction during the rundown
$Cesar Tovar's liner struck Denny McLain's left leg
ej,stotm101,P,nappl901,Call at HP Mel Stottlemyre ejected by HP umpire Larry Napp
$43 minute bomb delay with 2-1 count on Reese
$Snith hurt his arm on throw after catching Killebrew's fly, had to leave game
ej,brisd801,M,umonf901,Obstruction non-call $Brewers manager Bristol ejected by 2B umpire Umont for arguing catcher interferred with runner during rundown
Ken Berry left with pulled muscle in right leg
$Al Fitzmorris left with a sore shoulder while warming up
Amos Otis left with bruised rib cage sufferd in first at bat

ej,rignb101,M,dimul901,Fair/foul call (Kicked cap) ej,allib103,P,dimul901,Fair/foul call (from bench) $Leo Cardenas hit a fly ball down the LF line that the Twins thought hit the pole; 3B umpire Lou DiMuro ruled it a foul ball; Twins Manager Bill Rigney charged out to argue with HP umpire Larry Napp; when Napp did not change the call, Rigney ran to DiMuro and argued; Rigney was ejected by DiMuro; Rigney kicked his cap about 30 feet; Bob Allison ejected from the bench by DiMuro
